Don't edit this page, just click on the version number! --> | programming language = [[C (programming language)|C]] | operating system = | platform = | size = | language = English | status = Active | genre = [[Debugger]] | license = The Xdebug license | website = [http://www.xdebug.org/ www.xdebug.org] }} '''Xdebug''' is a [[PHP]] extension which provides debugging and profiling capabilities.<ref>{{cite book | last = McArthur | first = Kevin | authorlink = | title = Pro PHP: Patterns, Frameworks, Testing and More | date = 2008-03-24 | publisher = [[Apress]] | location = [[New York City, New York]] | isbn = 1-59059-819-9 | pages = 120 – 124 | chapter = Testing, Development, and Continuous Integration }}</ref> It uses the [[DBGp]] debugging protocol. The debug information that Xdebug can provide includes the following: * [[Stack trace|stack]] and function traces in error messages<ref>{{cite book | last1 = Sklar | first1 = David | authorlink1 = | last2 = Trachtenberg | first2 = Adam | authorlink2 = | title = PHP Cookbook | edition = 2nd | date = 2009-05-11 | publisher = [[O'Reilly Media]] | location = [[Sebastopol, CA]] | isbn = 0-596-10101-5 | page = 618 – 619 | chapter = Error Handling, Debugging, and Testing }}</ref> with: :*full parameter display for user defined functions :*function name, file name and line indications :*support for member functions * memory allocation * protection for [[Infinite loop|infinite recursions]] Xdebug also provides: * profiling information for PHP scripts<ref>{{cite book | last = Henderson | first = Cal | authorlink = | title = Building Scalable Web Sites | date = 2006-05-16 | publisher = [[O'Reilly Media]] | location = [[Sebastopol, CA]] | isbn = 0-596-10235-6 | pages = 170 – 171 | chapter = Bottlenecks }}</ref> * code coverage analysis * capabilities to debug your scripts interactively with a [[debugger front-end]].<ref>{{cite book | last1 = Masters | first1 = Jon | authorlink1 = | last2 = Blum | first2 = Richard | authorlink2 = | title = Professional Linux Programming | date = 2007-03-12 | publisher = [[John Wiley & Sons]] | location = [[Hoboken, New Jersey]] | isbn = 0-471-77613-0 | page = 426 | chapter = LAMP }}</ref> Xdebug is also available via the [[PHP Extension Community Library|PECL]] library.<ref>{{cite book | last1 = Gerner | first1 = Jason | authorlink1 = | last2 =
